content: shades of the sixties juliet cap approximately 60 grams 100 yards worsted weight yarn for the original hat i used passport yarns london a discontinued yarn sold at michael s but you can use any worsted weight yarn you have on hand the cap pictured was crocheted using a vintage mercerized cotton yarn brunswick moonbeams try using a different color in each round i made a granny square stitch poncho using up all of my mom s leftover wool yarns and a similar stitch when i first learned to crochet size h crochet hook gauge is not critical round 1 chain 6 join into a ring using a slip_stitch round 2 chain 3 make 15 double_crochet into ring join with a slip_stitch to top of chain 3 16 double_crochet st round 3 chain 3 double_crochet into 1 stitch 2 double_crochet in every stitch around cluster join with a slip_stitch to top of chain 3 32 double_crochet st round 4 chain 3 double_crochet into 1 stitch *skip one stitch chain 1 2 double_crochet cluster in next stitch* repeat between * s around end with chain 1 skip 1 stitch join with a slip stitch to top of chain 3 16 cluster stitches 32 double_crochet round 5 increase round slip_stitch into top of next double_crochet slip_stitch into space st between next cluster chain 3 double_crochet into 1 space chain 1 *2 double_crochet in space between next set of stitches cluster stitch chain 1 cluster in same space cluster in next space chain 1* repeat between * s around join with a slip_stitch to top of chain 3 24 cluster stitches round 6 slip_stitch into top of next double_crochet slip_stitch into space between next st cluster chain 3 double_crochet into 1 space chain 1 *2 double_crochet in space between next set of stitches cluster stitch chain 1* repeat between * s around join with a slip_stitch to top of chain 3 24 cluster stitches round 7 increase round slip_stitch into top of next double_crochet slip_stitch into space st between next cluster chain 3 double_crochet into 1 space chain 1 *2 double_crochet in space between next set of stitches cluster stitch chain 1 cluster in same space cluster in next space chain 1 cluster in next space chain 1* repeat between * s around join with a slip_stitch to top of chain 3 32 cluster stitches repeat round 6 until cap measures about 9 in length cap will start to shape into cup shape after the increases are finished if you have a larger head repeat round 7 increase round before beginning round 8 finish with a round of single_crochet or crab stitch and weave in ends ©2008 by margie dougherty you may use this pattern for your own use not to
